isis.stitle: CAB: 5000i AND 9000i CONVENTIONAL - REMOVE - ignition KEY SWITCH CYLINDER

svcproc.title: ignition KEY SWITCH CYLINDER
svcproc.para: The ignition key switch and door locks are coded differently so that two separate keys operate ignition key switch and door locks. The code number is stamped on ignition key switch body just in back of cap nut. The code number does not appear on door lock assembly.
To locate code number on ignition key switch, remove ignition key switch mounting cap nut and remove ignition key switch from instrument panel.
At customer request, ignition key switch and door locks can be coded the same so that one key operates both ignition key switch and door lock cylinders.
Refer to Figure 19 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: The ignition key switch is located to left of driver in dash panel below instrument panel on both 5000 i and 9000 i Series. Remove ignition key switch as follows.
Remove push-in fasteners and screws and remove front trim panel (Item 1) from underneath dash panel (Item 2) and then remove left side trim panel (Item 3) to allow room to reach in behind dash panel.
Unscrew mounting cap nut (Item 4) and remove it from ignition key switch (Item 5).

figure.caption: Figure 19. Trim Panels and Ignition Key Switch Cap Nut
Figure 20. Ignition Key Switch in Dash Panel

svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 20 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Reach up behind dash panel (Item 1) and pull ignition key switch (Item 2) down and out of dash panel.

svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 21 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Disconnect electrical connector (Item 1) from back of ignition key switch (Item 2) and remove from vehicle.

svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 22 below for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Insert ignition key (Item 1) into ignition key switch (Item 2) and rotate counterclockwise to accessory position, so that key is lined up with release hole (Item 3) in ignition key switch body.

figure.caption: Figure 22. Position Ignition Key Switch for Switch Cylinder Removal

svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 23 below for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: Insert a 1/16 inch (1.6 mm) diameter pin (paper clip) (Item 1) into release hole (Item 3, Figure 22) in ignition key switch body (Item 2) of ignition key switch and depress switch cylinder retainer.

figure.caption: Figure 23. Switch Cylinder and Ignition Key Switch Body

svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 24 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Pull complete switch cylinder and ignition key (Items 1 and 3) from ignition key switch body (Item 2).

figure.caption: Figure 24. Remove or Install Switch Cylinder

note.para: If vehicle keys are lost, drill out switch cylinder. Using a 5/16 inch (8 mm) drill bit, drill 1/2 to 3/4 inch (12.7 to 19 mm) deep. This will permit tumblers to drop out and free switch cylinder.
